ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Gardens of Eden, whose gates will be open to them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Gardens of Eden with gates open wide to them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: -- everlasting Gardens with gates wide open for them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will enter gardens of Eden with their gates open for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Everlasting Gardens – all its gates are open for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: `Adn Paradise, whose doors will be opened for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The gardens of perpetuity, the doors are opened for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are open to them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are opened for them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the Gardens of eternity with gates thrown wide open to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Gardens Everlasting, whereof the portals remain opened for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: the Gardens of Eden, whose gates will be flung open for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Gardens of Eternity, whose doors will (ever) be open to them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Adn (Edn) Paradise (everlasting Gardens), whose doors will be open for them, [It is said (in Tafsir At-Tabari, Part 23, Page 174) that one can speak to the doors, just one tells it to open and close, and it will open or close as it is ordered].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: the Gardens of Eden whose gates shall be open to them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The Gardens of Eden, with their doors wide-open for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:50] Gardens of Eden (jannāti ‘Adnin is either a substitution for, or an explicative supplement to, husna ma’ābin, ‘a fair return’) whose gates are [flung] open for them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah explained where they will dwell in the Hereafter, saying: (Gardens of Eden) the source of prophets and righteous, (whereof the gates are opened for them) on the Day of Judgement. 525
